intro: Microlicia euphorbioides var. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered microlicia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often yellow or white in color. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and the plant is adapted to thrive in humid, shady environments.
